intro: Galium pedemontanum var. vestitum, commonly known as the dressed bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, prostrate stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving the plant a soft, textured appearance. Galium pedemontanum var. vestitum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
